title: Leona is Freelo

replies.body: Dont underestimate yourself. Its not luck. Leona takes effort to master and seems like u are on a right path. Good luck! Also go for a bit more CDR. Maybe Frozen Heart.

It does take effort. You gotta know when to rush in with E > Q, or whemn to just zone them a bit and save your Q for letting your ADC decide for themselves if theyre at low HP. Leona's kit helps her go all-in and lock down several targets while the rest of her team opens fire for tons of damage thanks to her passive

Yo, my go-to support is Leona, and I disagree with your assertion that she takes skill. She might be the single most aggressive champion in the game, and all the player needs is to know when to go hard and when not to. That's pretty much it, and it's not even a difficult judgement call to make.

Are you and your carry at similar health to your lane opponents? Go hard in the motherfucking paint.

Are you significantly weaker? Wait for a gank, **then** you go hard and you **die** for that double kill.

Does the enemy have an effective disengage? Harass; don't go hard.

For everything else it's zone and peel as appropriate.

If you're following these simple rules, and your lane isn't an oppressive hellhole for the enemies, it's probably because your carry is a quivering fuckboy who can't keep up with you.

No, but for real, Leona is easy.

it's not that it works for me, it's that it works for everyone, at every elo. It is incompetent for a support to not build it.

http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/rankings/warding/bronze

Including in bronze, where warding is nearly non-existent, a +10 ward differential translates to a +10% winrate. Vision is broken. You can adjust the graph to see different elos to see that every support in every situation gets a sightstone and upgrades a sweeper into an oracle.

You can also check probuilds.net and see every pro do the same.

No question you can win games in bronze without it, but your "lucky streak" as you call it will soon hit a wall if you don't build correctly.
